text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires advising the use of notary escrow for payments. The candidate answer mentions using an escrow account offered by some notaries in section 3.D under 'Fraudulent Agents or Sellers' as a solution to payment risks, but it is not presented as a primary or general piece of advice regarding the handling of the deposit or subsequent payments, which is the core of the criterion's intent (securing funds during the transaction). It is mentioned as an optional measure against fraud rather than a standard best practice for handling the deposit (caparra confirmatoria) or the final balance.", "criterion_id": "8ad4ca61-9dde-4bce-bb70-9ec81b522378"}
